Sequence Information.Target Organism: [Ref.22526241] Gram-positive bacteria:Micrococcus luteus (MIC = 1 μM), Bacillus subtilis (MIC = 0.5 μM), Staphylococcus aureus (MIC = 2.5 μM);Gram-negative bacteria:E.coli (MIC = 0.9 μM), Pseudomonas aeruginosa (MIC = 17.3 μM);Fungi:Candida albicans (MIC = 15 μM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: [Ref.22526241] LC50 = 50 μM. Note:LC50 is the concentration of a peptide able to lyse 50% of human erthrocytes in the assay.
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Structure Description: No other descriptive information about the structure found in the literature
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria and Antifungal activity against Candida albicans.

Literature.Title: Effect of hydrocarbon stapling on the properties of α-helical antimicrobial peptides isolated from the venom of hymenoptera
Literature.Author: Hubert Chapuis, Jiřina Slaninová, Lucie Bednárová, Lenka Monincová, Miloš Buděšínský, Václav Čeřovský
